PRIVACY POLICY

General provisions

The administrator of the data is Ignibit S.A. with its registered office in Gdynia, al. Zwycięstwa 96/98, building 2, platform f17, entered into the Register of Entrepreneurs under KRS number 0000677637, for which the registration files are kept by the District Court for Gdańsk-Północ in Gdańsk, Commercial Division of the National Court Register, NIP: 5862305786, REGON: 364268396, data protection is performed in accordance with the requirements of generally applicable law, and their storage takes place on secure servers.

For the interpretation of terms, a glossary of the Regulations is used or as described in the Privacy Policy (if it results directly from the description). For the purpose of better reception of the Privacy Policy, the term "User" has been replaced by the term "You", "Administrator" - "We". The term 'ORDER' means Regulation (EU) No 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data and repealing Directive 95/46/EC.

We respect the right to privacy and take care of data security. Among other things, a secure encryption protocol for communication (SSL) is used for this purpose. The personal data provided on the landing page is treated as confidential and is not visible to unauthorized persons.

Data controller

The service provider is the data controller of its customers. This means that if you have an Account with us, we will process your data such as your name, email address, telephone number, job title, work address and IP address.

The service provider is also the administrator of persons subscribed to the newsletter and persons subscribed to the webinar.

Personal data are processed:
a. in accordance with the regulations on the protection of personal data,
b. in accordance with the regulations on the protection of personal data. in accordance with the implemented Privacy Policy,
c. in the scope and purpose necessary to establish, shape the content of the Agreement, change or terminate it and correctly perform the Services provided electronically,
d. to the extent and for the purpose necessary for the fulfilment of legitimate interests (legitimate purposes) and the processing does not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of the data subject:
in the scope and purpose consistent with the consent given by you if you subscribed to the newsletter,
to the extent and for the purpose stated in your consent if you subscribe to a webinar.

Every data subject (if a controller) has the right to access, rectify, erase or restrict the processing, the right to object, the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

Contact with the person supervising the processing of personal data in the organisation of the Service Provider is possible by e-mail at the following address: office@vrvisio.com

We reserve the right to process your personal data after termination of this Agreement or withdrawal of your consent only to the extent that we are able to pursue any legal claims or if we are required by national, EU or international law to retain your personal data.

The Service Provider has the right to make the User's personal data and other data available to entities authorised under the relevant provisions of law (e.g. law enforcement authorities).

Deletion of personal data may take place as a result of withdrawal of consent or lodging of a legally admissible objection to the processing of personal data. The Service Provider shall not disclose personal data to entities other than those authorised under the applicable provisions of law.

We have implemented pseudonymization, data encryption and we have implemented access control so that we can minimize the effects of possible data security breaches. Personal data are processed only by persons authorized by us or by the processor with whom we closely cooperate.

Cookies

17. playzerokilled.com uses cookies. These are small text files sent by a web server and stored by the browser's computer software. When your browser re-connects to the page, the page recognizes the type of device you are connecting to. Parameters allow to read information contained in them only to the server that created them. Cookies therefore make it easier to use previously visited websites.

The information we collect includes your IP address, browser type, language, operating system type, Internet service provider, time and date information, location, and information we send to you through the contact form.

18. The information we collect is used to monitor and verify how users use our websites to improve the performance of the service by providing more efficient and trouble-free navigation. We monitor your information using Google Analytics, which records your behaviour on the website.

Cookies identify you so that the content of the website you are using can be tailored to your needs. By remembering his preferences, he allows you to adjust the ads addressed to him accordingly. We use cookies to guarantee the highest standard of comfort of our website, and the data collected is used only within Ignibit S.A. in order to optimize operations.

We use the following cookies on our website: a) "necessary" cookies enabling the use of services available within the website, e.g. authentication of cookies used for services requiring authentication within the website;
(b) security cookies, such as those used to detect authentication fraud within the service;
(c) 'performance' cookies, which provide a means of collecting information on how to use the website;
(d) 'functional' cookies which allow the user to 'remember' and personalise the user interface of his choice, for example, with regard to the language or region chosen, the font size, the design of the website, etc;
(e) 'advertising' cookies, which make it possible to provide users with advertising content more suited to their interests.

The user has the possibility at any time to disable or restore the option of collecting cookies by changing the settings in the web browser. Instructions on how to manage cookies are available on the following website http://www.allaboutcookies.org/manage-cookies

Additional personal data, such as e-mail addresses, are collected only in places where the user has explicitly consented to this by filling in the form. We store and use the above data only for the purposes necessary to perform a given function.
